column6: A section title should start with a capital letter.

column5: A section title should not end with a punctuation symbol.
A section title should not be written in all caps. The LaTeX stylesheet takes care of rendering titles in caps if needed.

column7: A paragraph heading should start with a capital letter.

column6: A paragraph heading should not end with a punctuation symbol.
A paragraph heading should not be written in all caps. The LaTeX stylesheet takes care of rendering titles in caps if needed.

column10: Use a backslash after the period; otherwise LaTeX will think it is a full stop ending a sentence.

column11: Use a backslash after the second period; otherwise LaTeX will think it is a full stop ending a sentence.

column12: Utilisez '\fg{}' au lieu de '\fg'; sinon le mot suivant sera collé au guillemet fermant.

column9: Add a space before citation or reference.

column5: Remove space between citation/reference and punctuation.

column6: Do not use '$1 [X]': the syntax of a sentence should not be changed by the removal of a citation.

column5: Put all references in a single \cite command

column4: Put all references in a single \cite$1 command

column8: Use a capital letter when referring to a specific figure: 'Figure X'
Use a capital letter when referring to a specific section: 'Section X'
Use a capital letter when referring to a specific chapter: 'Chapter X'
Use a capital letter when referring to a specific table: 'Table X'
Do not refer to figures using hard-coded numbers. Use \ref instead.

column7: Do not refer to sections using hard-coded numbers. Use \ref instead.
Do not refer to chapters using hard-coded numbers. Use \ref instead.

column8: Do not refer to tables using hard-coded numbers. Use \ref instead.

column11: If you are writing a research paper, do not force page breaks.

column12: N'utilisez pas d'espace insécable; c'est plutôt une espace fine qui doit être utilisée, et LaTeX se charge de l'insérer par lui-même.
